results.title: Junkie's ruminations
results.creator_credit: Kylie O'Brien and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Kylie O’Brien feels society has reviled drug users. She provides an insight to the world through her eyes, as well as through her art and music.

results.title: Junior road safety: only one way
results.creator_credit: Grahame Jennings and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Encourages the correct use of seat belts, and highlights the dangers of playing games on the road and crossing the road between parked cars. Designed for children from 7 to 11 years.

results.title: Junior Bonner
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Joe Wizan and ABC Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: Sam Peckinpah eschews his slow-motion bullet ballets for this quiet character study of ex-rodeo cowboy turned drifter, Junior Bonner, who returns home to Arizona to reconcile with the family he hasn’t seen in years. Bonner is shocked to see that the solid family he was hoping to come back to is breaking apart. His parents, Ace and Elvira, have separated, and his brother Curley has turned into a heartless real estate tycoon, parcelling off sections of his parents’ land for quick money. With nowhere to turn and nowhere to run, Bonner has to face himself and try to find a way to regain his self-respect. Cast includes: Steve McQueen, Robert Preston, Ida Lupino, Ben Johnson and Joe Don Baker.

results.title: Jungle road
results.brief_description: Papua and New guinea today, showing the terrain, people and customs; technical training of the natives; development of agricultural schemes and health services carried out by the New Guinea administration; role of the Twenty-First Construction Squadron of Royal Australian Engineers building new roads, providing electric power and telephone services, constructing houses, a jetty and an airstrip. A new road being built through the rugged Torricelli Mountain range from Wewak to Maprik.

results.title: Jungle patrol
results.creator_credit: Tom Gurr and Commonwealth Department of Information
results.brief_description: An account of a jungle patrol by eight Australian soldiers in the Dumpu to Shaggy Ridge area of New Guinea during WWII. The film unit flew with the Australian patrol to the Ramu Valley and marched with it to the outpost of Shaggy Ridge in the Finisterre Range. The film shows the difficulties and dangers of the campaign - rain, mud swamps, tangled jungles and steep mountains - with the cameraman taking all risks under fire from the enemy. The soldiers were: Pte A.N. McGregor, L/Cpl A.C. Pierson, Pte R.F.C. Northcott, Pte A.B. Graffin, Pte M.J. Driver, Cpl R.A. Box, Pte J.H. Adams, Pte E. Barmby. Photography by J.W. Trerise and William Carty.

results.title: Jungle girl. Vol. 02
results.creator_credit: John English, William Witney, Hiram S. Brown Jr and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Frances Gifford stars in the title role as Nyoka, a young woman living in the African jungle with her physician father. When the doctor’s evil twin murders him and assumes his identity in order to search for a fortune in diamonds hidden nearby, Nyoka and two pilots must escape the plans of the sinister sibling and his henchmen. Cast includes Tom Neal and Trevor Bardette. Originally screened in cinemas as 20 minute serials, volume two contains the last eight episodes.

results.title: Jungle girl. Vol. 01
results.creator_credit: John English, William Witney, Hiram S. Brown Jr and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Frances Gifford stars in the title role as Nyoka, a young woman living in the African jungle with her physician father. When the doctor’s evil twin murders him and assumes his identity in order to search for a fortune in diamonds hidden nearby, Nyoka and two pilots must escape the plans of the sinister sibling and his henchmen. Cast includes Tom Neal and Trevor Bardette. Originally screened in cinemas as 20 minute serials, volume one contains the first seven episodes. The story is loosely based on Edgar Rice Burroughs’ story, “The Land of hidden men” published in 1929. Detailed information on Jungle Girl can be found at: http://www.serialsquadron.com/video/jungle/queens/nyoka/junglegirl/

results.title: Jungle Fighters at Canungra School
results.brief_description: Forty miles south-west of Brisbane, at Canungra, troops of the 2nd Battalion are being turned into skilled jungle fighters. After an initial toughening course, training is done on a course consisting of obstacles the soldier could normally expect to find in jungle warfare. As the jungle affords many hiding places for the enemy, a course in snap-shooting is given. Training also includes detection of booby traps and trip wires, security precautions, sneaking, ability to gain information from objects left by the enemy indicating his path, position and strength, learning to take advantages of trees, tree climbing and assault training.

results.title: Jungle bunny [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Zok Nyste, Fotini Manikakis and AFTRS
results.brief_description: With the phrase “I’ll take that one”, African tribesman Mbuti Matabuiki Lobiko finds himself sharing a household with Australian housewife Clarissa Penfold and her family. A humorous fable that looks at the way we exploit each other both consciously and unconsciously, across all levels of our relationships - cultural, national, racial, sexual and personal. Cast includes Renny Augustine, Genevieve Mooy and Neil Fitzpatrick.

results.title: Jungle book
results.creator_credit: Zoltan Korda, Alexander Korda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A young boy returns to his native village attempting to adapt to human customs and his adopted family. The discovery of a coin in the jungle awakens the greed of the village people who hope to discover a legendary buried treasure. Disillusioned by the greed and violence of humanity he retreats to his loyal and trusted friends…the beasts of the jungle. Stars Sabu. Based on “Jungle book” by Rudyard Kipling.
